bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 20, 1915

div1.p: Blue requests Carter's opinion in regard to ordinances against mosquito propagation.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 20, 1915
div1.opener:
J.R.S.
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 20, 1915.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:-
div1.p:
There is enclosed draft of a model ordinance, entitled
“Mosquitoes - Prevention of Propagation,” prepared by Surgeon
R. H. von Ezdorf with a view to its being recommended by the
Service for adoption by city authorities. For purposes of
comparison there is also enclosed copy of a similar ordinance
adopted in Alexandria, La., and published in the Public Health
Reports of August 28, 1914, see page 2284.

No legal opinion has thus far been obtained in regard to
the form of this ordinance, and an expression of your views is
desired in regard to the advisability of publishing it in its
present form, or as to any changes which would seem advisable.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General. J
Inc.
